result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob J. Hardman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: TRANSCRIPT OF SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION HELD ON 2/24/16 - KAREN BLAIR, REPORTER

Defendant Jacob J. Hardman in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Defendant Jacob J. Hardman in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the revocation order and the recommendation.  In addition, Mr. Hardman was placed on Probation in Adams County for similar offenses and the defendant has been sentenced in that matter.  
Court questions the defense.  Atty Henney states that the defendant has received that revocation summary and has no corrections.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations of prison sentence; consecutive to the Adams County case.    State has complied with victim notification requirements.
Atty Henney makes sentencing arguments.  
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 5 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 1 year Initial Confinement and 4 years Extended Supervision with conditions; consecutive to the Adams County case:
*All conditions recommended by the Agent
*Challange Incarceration Program
*Substance Abuse Program
*All outstanding balances of court costs, surcharges and restitution will be converted to a Civil Judgment for $12,598.31.
Credit was applied in the Adams County case; no jail credit for Marquette County's case.

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob J. Hardman

from defendant
RESTITUTION INFORMATION

Defendant Jacob J. Hardman in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM41 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  15CM41 to be dismissed.  Atty Henney agrees and states that it would be concurrent to Adams County case 15CF54.  Atty Hendee agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.  15CM41 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Henney makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Henney states that the jail time in Adams has been stayed until September and asks that this court order that as well.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
6 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before , 2015 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May serve in Juneau County
Court Costs = $268.00
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
DNA Sample + $250.00 surcharge (Sample to be done today)
Restitution = $13,861.34; joint and several with Neil Aguilar, Thomas Fraley, Derek Martz, Nicholas Rivera or Bryan DeVore as to supplement

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Both parties have waived a PSI.
15CM41 to be dismissed.
Plea hearing at 07-23-2015 09:00 am

Attorney Timothy C. Henney in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests warrant but requests it be stayed until next hearing date.  Atty Henney states there is a resolution and is not sure where his client is today; although, thinks his client thought he would handle his Adams County case first.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue but is stayed until after his next scheduled appearance.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing at 06-18-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Jacob J. Hardman in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea.
bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob J. Hardman in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF97 & 15CM41:

15CM41:
  Atty Henney received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Henney enters a Not Guilty plea.
BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions since there is a cash bond in the felony matter.
Atty Henney has no objection.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

14CF97:
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Henney; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Henney agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Henney states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return in both matters.
bond continued in both cases.  Return date scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
